required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Treat Small Cell Lung Cancer With a Combination of Cisplatin, Pemetrexed, and Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II Study of Concurrent Cisplatin, Pemetrexed, and Radiotherapy for Limited Stage Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the recommended dose of pemetrexed, cisplatin and radiotherapy in the treatment of patients with Small Cell Lung Cancer.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Interim results of another trial showed inferior activity of treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease
baseline to date of death from any cause

intervention.description: Phase 1: 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles
Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles
Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 Gy, 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Measurable disease with diagnosis of Small Cell Lung Cancer.
- Performance status of 0 to 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status schedule.
- Patients must be at least 18 years of age and have at least a 12-week life expectancy.
- No prior chemotherapy and/or prior thoracic radiotherapy.
- Adequate pulmonary function and organ function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with myocardial infarction within the preceding six months.
- Diagnosis of a serious concomitant systemic disorder.
- Prior radiotherapy to the lower neck or abdominal region.
- Significant weight loss.
- Concurrent administration of any other antitumor therapy.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This was a Phase 1/2 trial that was terminated during Phase 1 and never progressed to Phase 2. The number of patients enrolled is for the Phase 1 portion.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

outcome.title: Phase 1: Maximum Tolerated Dose
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial and it was too early to assess the recommended dose for Phase 2, or to estimate the maximum tolerated dose (MTD).

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

measure.title: Phase 1: Maximum Tolerated Dose
measure.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial and it was too early to assess the recommended dose for Phase 2, or to estimate the maximum tolerated dose (MTD).

outcome.title: Phase 2: Overall Response Rate
outcome.description: Overall Response Rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of participants having either a Complete or Partial response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

measure.title: Phase 2: Overall Response Rate
measure.description: Overall Response Rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of participants having either a Complete or Partial response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
measure.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

outcome.title: Phase 1: Best Overall Response
outcome.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial and was stopped too early to assess best overall response.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

measure.title: Phase 1: Best Overall Response
measure.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial and was stopped too early to assess best overall response.

outcome.title: Phase 2: Complete Response Rate
outcome.description: Complete Response Rate was defined as the proportion of participants having a Complete Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions.
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

measure.title: Phase 2: Complete Response Rate
measure.description: Complete Response Rate was defined as the proportion of participants having a Complete Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions.
measure.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

outcome.title: Phase 2: Time to Progressive Disease
outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first date of disease progression. Time to disease progression was censored at the date of death if death was due to other cause.
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: Phase 1: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then 400 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles (dose escalation) Phase 2: pemetrexed - 500 mg/m2 then phase 1 determined dose, IV, every 21 days x 4 cycles Cisplatin: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles Radiation: Phase 1 and Phase 2: 50-62 gray (Gy), 25-31 days, cycles 2-4

measure.title: Phase 2: Time to Progressive Disease
measure.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first date of disease progression. Time to disease progression was censored at the date of death if death was due to other cause.
measure.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

outcome.title: Phase 2: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause.
outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin

measure.title: Phase 2: Duration of Response
measure.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause.
measure.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

outcome.title: Phase 2: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival was the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who were alive, overall survival was censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause
outcome.population: This trial was terminated during the Phase 1 portion of this Phase 1/2 trial. No patients were entered into the Phase 2 portion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The Study Phase 1 was stopped early based on interim results of another trial, showing inferior activity of pemetrexed/carboplatin compared to etoposide/carboplatin in extensive small cell lung cancer. The Study did not progress to Phase 2.
